poem:
### A Green Legacy

In the city's hum, Mathew walks,  
tranquil shepherd of hidden greens,  
edging wild against concrete dreams.  
From the bustle's bounds,  
his hands map urban solace—  
each fox's den,  
each bird's nest known  
within the steel embrace.

He leaves us breathing softer,  
among corridors of the untamed  
whispering his legacy.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mathew Frith obituary My friend Mathew Frith, an urban nature conservationist, who has died aged 64 from a glioblastoma (brain tumour), was best known for his work in London, but leaves a national legacy of championing urban nature, pioneering citizen science, saving wildlife sites from development, and improving public access to green space. In 1989 he joined the staff of the London Wildlife Trust, a charity founded on a vision for a greener, more inclusive". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Mathew Frith obituary My friend Mathew Frith, an urban nature conservationist, who has died aged 64 from a glioblastoma (brain tumour), was best known for his work in London, but leaves a national legacy of championing urban nature, pioneering citizen science, saving wildlife sites from development, and improving public access to green space. In 1989 he joined the staff of the London Wildlife Trust, a charity founded on a vision for a greener, more inclusive
